intro: Frasera ampla, commonly known as the showy frasera, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Gentianaceae and is characterized by its striking, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils in mountainous regions. It has lance-shaped leaves and produces showy, clustered inflorescences. Frasera ampla is often found in meadows and along stream banks, where it thrives in partial to full sunlight.
